name: multi-cursor-search
description: Search from multiple cursors at once.

multiCursorSearch.plainSearch.ignoreCase.description: Specifies if case should be ignored when performing plain searches. Internally, this enables the i regex flag.
multiCursorSearch.plainSearch.ignoreCase.markdownDescription: Specifies if case should be ignored when performing **plain searches**. Internally, this enables the `i` regex flag. See the [JavaScript RegExp docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp#Parameters).

multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.ignoreCase.description: Specifies if the ignore case (i) flag should be used when performing regex searches.
multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.ignoreCase.markdownDescription: Specifies if the ignore case (`i`) flag should be used when performing **regex searches**. See the [JavaScript RegExp docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp#Parameters).

multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.multiline.description: Specifies if the multiline (m) flag should be used when performing regex searches.
multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.multiline.markdownDescription: Specifies if the multiline (`m`) flag should be used when performing **regex searches**. See the [JavaScript RegExp docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp#Parameters).

multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.dotAll.description: Specifies if the "dotAll" (s) flag should be used when performing regex searches.
multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.dotAll.markdownDescription: Specifies if the "dotAll" (`s`) flag should be used when performing **regex searches**. See the [JavaScript RegExp docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp#Parameters).

multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.unicode.description: Specifies if the Unicode (u) flag should be used when performing regex searches.
multiCursorSearch.regexSearch.unicode.markdownDescription: Specifies if the Unicode (`u`) flag should be used when performing **regex searches**. See the [JavaScript RegExp docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp#Parameters).
